column1: The seminar leader was well prepared
column2: The seminar leader gave interesting and informative classes
column3: The seminar leader explained the subject clearly
column4: The seminar leader was effective in leading the class or seminar
column5: The seminar leader is receptive to students' questions
column6: The seminar leader stimulates interest in the subject
column7: The seminar leader stimulates discussion on the subject

column11: What have been the positive features of this module up to this point?

column11: The office hours - very helpful and informative. attending every week has boosted my confidence
column12: the lectures. more slides explaining the concepts will make it easy to follow through

column11: Good class discussions and the seminar leader is able to answer all relevant questions
column12: Ensure work is done before class so people can discuss

column11: The content has been interesting however challenging yet, Hugo has a great way of explaining all the advanced stuff.
column12: Essay options I'm not a great fan of, it seems the one I'm doing Bill has already fully answered making it hard to gage my own opinion on it

column11: I find it helpful to have questions sent by my seminar leader regarding the readings as they allow me to guide myself whilst reading. The questions also allow me to test my understanding of the reading.
column12: Not something that's easy to resolve, but the timing of the first lecture makes it a bit difficult for people to get to, as well as the location being Strand. But in the lecture recording, the sound is usually a bit quiet.

column11: Hugo is always very encouraging of open discussions, and has a good rapport with the students in my seminar. Most students are confident in contributing to these discussions regardless of their confidence in understanding at the start. Hugo always answers questions making sure that we can fully clarify understanding.
The different views discussed on topics. It’s also nice that our seminar lead is enthusiastic about the topics we discuss.
The seminars are really useful for understanding the readings.
column12: I think that the readings are a bit too complex to understand for students not doing a philosophy based degree and who haven't experienced this level of philosophy before.
The lectures at 9am are hard to get to
